intro: Melandrium akinfijewii, commonly known as the Caucasian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Melandrium akinfijewii is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
